item.title: 研究称，过量降雨每年导致孟买损失 12 亿美元，并造成 2,700 人死亡
item.description: 一项新的研究显示，在孟买，暴雨造成的死亡人数远远多于公开记录中的数字，约占印度金融首都季风季节死亡总人数的 8%，在截至 2015 年的十年间，每年造成的损失达 12 亿美元。【原文：Severe rains killed far more people in Mumbai than listed in public records, accounting for roughly 8% of all deaths in India’s financial capital during the monsoon season and $1.2 billion in losses every year in the decade through 2015, a new study shows.】

item.title: 俄勒冈州野火索赔增加威胁伯克希尔旗下 PacifiCorp 公司评级
item.description: 伯克希尔哈撒韦能源公司（Berkshire Hathaway Energy Co.【原文：A Berkshire Hathaway Energy Co.-owned utility is at risk of losing its investment-grade credit rating as it expects to have to pay up more money for litigation brought by victims of 2020 wildfires in Oregon.】

item.title: 电池公司联手部署钠离子动力系统
item.description: 两家电池公司正在联手实施一项计划，在美国部署依靠钠离子技术的储能系统。【原文：Two battery companies are joining forces with a plan to deploy energy storage systems in the US that rely on sodium-ion technology.】

item.title: 数十亿资金流入美国核工业，但回报仍需数年时间
item.description:
华盛顿对核反应堆的 800 亿美元投资不会很快产生无碳电力。【原文：

Washington’s $80 billion investment in nuclear reactors won’t yield carbon-free power anytime soon.

】

item.title: 加文-纽瑟姆在 COP30 峰会上发出挑衅的声音
item.description: 加利福尼亚州州长为亚马逊带来了一点好莱坞的活力。加文-纽森抵达贝伦，是对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普决定不派遣美国官方代表团的尖锐抨击。【原文：Leave it to California’s governor to bring a little Hollywood energy to the Amazon. Gavin Newsom arrived in Belém as a pointed rebuke to US President Donald Trump’s decision not to send an official US delegation.】

item.title: 欧洲国家寻求将森林砍伐法延期一年实施
item.description: 欧盟国家正在推动将一项遏制全球森林砍伐的里程碑式法律推迟一年实施，以寻求比该集团执行机构提议的更多时间来遵守该法律。【原文：European Union nations are pushing for a one-year delay of a landmark law to curb deforestation across the world, seeking more time to comply with it than proposed by the bloc’s executive arm.】

item.title: 推广碳捕集的科学家对此提出警告
item.description:
许多国家依靠它来实现其气候目标，但他们表示，这可能弊大于利。【原文：

Many countries are relying on it to meet their climate goals, but it might hurt more than help, they say.

】

item.title: 抗议者对抗巴西 COP30 气候峰会安保人员
item.description: 周二晚，一群抗议者在贝伦 COP30 蓝区入口处与保安人员发生冲突。【原文：A group of protesters clashed with security guards on Tuesday night at the entrance to the COP30 Blue Zone in Belém, the restricted area managed by the United Nations where official climate negotiations take place.】

item.title: 中国、巴西立志成为气候领跑者，也要继续污染环境
item.description:
COP30的东道主和世界上最大的排放国在寻求成为绿色卫士的同时，也在钻探更多的石油。【原文：

The host of COP30 and the world's top emitter seek to be green champions, while also drilling for more oil.

】

item.title: 纽森斥责缺席巴西气候谈判的特朗普
item.description: 加利福尼亚州州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）大张旗鼓地参加了在巴西举行的 COP30 气候峰会。【原文：California Governor Gavin Newsom swept into the COP30 climate summit in Brazil with all the fanfare of a head of state.】

item.title: 腾讯酝酿成立碳信用联盟以促进供应
item.description: 腾讯公司气候创新中心的一位官员表示，腾讯控股有限公司正在与中国境内外的公司进行谈判，以组建一个碳信用购买者联盟，旨在增加碳信用的供应。【原文：Tencent Holdings Ltd. is in talks with companies in and outside China to form an alliance of carbon credit buyers aimed at increasing the supply, according to an official at the company’s Climate Innovation Hub.】

item.title: 欧洲投资银行考虑投资巴西具有里程碑意义的热带森林基金
item.description: 据欧洲投资银行副总裁 Ambroise Fayolle 透露，该银行正在与欧盟委员会讨论对巴西保护全球热带森林旗舰基金进行投资的可能性。【原文：The European Investment Bank is in discussions with the European Commission over a potential investment in Brazil’s flagship fund to protect tropical forests worldwide, according to the bank’s Vice President Ambroise Fayolle.】

item.title: 研究称，各国政府在气候成本方面存在盲目性
item.description: 大多数国家的政府都不知道自己在应对气候变化方面花了多少钱，也不知道如何应对气候变化日益恶化的影响。【原文：Most governments have little idea how much they spend on fighting climate change — or how to cope with its worsening effects.】

item.title: Blackrock 投资的巴西能源公司寻求收购太阳能企业
item.description: Blackrock Inc. 支持的一家巴西可再生能源公司在巴西考察了 200 亿雷亚尔（38 亿美元）的小型太阳能资产，并提出收购其中约四分之一的资产，一些交易可能在今年完成。【原文：A Brazilian renewable energy company backed by Blackrock Inc. has looked at 20 billion reais ($3.8 billion) of small-scale solar energy assets in Brazil and has offered to acquire about a quarter of them, with some deals potentially closing this year.】

item.title: 强风暴肆虐价值数十亿美元的防御设施
item.description: COP30 上正在酝酿着强大的风暴。飓风 "梅丽莎 "加剧了关于谁应为气候变化引发的灾害买单的讨论，并揭示了一个令人不安的现实：在全球变暖的时代，应对极端天气的防御措施不足，尤其是在全球南部地区。【原文：Powerful storms are brewing over COP30. Hurricane Melissa is intensifying discussions of who should pay for climate change-fueled disasters and shining a light on the unsettling reality that defenses against extreme weather, especially in the Global South, are inadequate for the global warming era.】

item.title: 由于需求不确定，印度将无法实现 2030 年氢能目标
item.description: 印度一位高级官员周二表示，由于全球政策转变迫使该行业重新调整，印度很可能无法实现 2030 年年产 500 万吨绿色氢气的目标。【原文：India will likely miss its 2030 goal of producing 5 million tons of green hydrogen annually, as global policy shifts force a recalibration of the industry, a senior official said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 梅利莎显示气候变化正以多快的速度超越防御能力
item.description:
随着 COP30 的开幕，飓风的肆虐凸显了富裕国家应为脆弱国家的适应和损失与破坏支付多少费用这一争议性问题。【原文：

As COP30 kicks off, the hurricane’s rampage spotlights the contentious issue of how much rich countries should pay for adaptation and loss and damage in vulnerable nations.

】

item.title: COP30 气候峰会谈判室内的名人录
item.description: 来自近 200 个国家的代表齐聚巴西亚马逊的贝伦，参加将于 11 月 21 日结束的联合国 COP30 气候大会。【原文：Delegates from nearly 200 countries have gathered in Belém in the Brazilian Amazon for the United Nations’ COP30 climate conference, running through Nov. 21.】

item.title: 印度首都在抗议活动后加强反污染措施
item.description: 本周二，印度对新德里及其周边地区实施了更严格的污染控制措施，此前曾发生罕见的公众抗议活动，要求采取更有力的行动。【原文：India imposed stricter pollution control measures for New Delhi and its neighboring regions on Tuesday following rare public protests demanding stronger action.】

item.title: 亚马逊紧张会谈旨在重燃气候雄心
item.description:
随着 COP30 在贝伦拉开帷幕，英国气候事务特别代表雷切尔-凯特（Rachel Kyte）向《零点》杂志介绍了哪个国家可能成为这些关键谈判的领导者。【原文：

As COP30 kicks off in Belem, Rachel Kyte, the UK’s special representative for climate, tells Zero which country might emerge the leader in these crucial negotiations.

】

item.title: 阿达尼计划建造印度最大的电池储能系统
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）计划在印度西部建造一个价值数十亿美元的电池储能系统，以支持其集团的可再生能源雄心。【原文：Billionaire Gautam Adani plans to build a multi-billion dollar battery energy storage system in western India to support his group’s renewable energy ambitions, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国 9 月排放量下降使全年降幅保持不变
item.description: 据能源与清洁空气研究中心（Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air）称，9月份中国碳排放量的下降表明，今年仍有可能出现年度下降，这将成为全球气候的一个转折点。【原文：A drop in Chinese carbon emissions in September suggests this year could still see an annual decline, according to the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air, in what would be a global climate turning point.】

item.title: 卢拉敦促各国在 COP30 会议开始之际消除气候否认现象
item.description: 联合国气候谈判周一拉开帷幕，巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva）恳请各国打击阻挠应对全球变暖的阻挠者。【原文：Brazil’s President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva implored nations to strike a blow to obstructionists blocking the fight against global warming as UN climate negotiations kicked off Monday.】

item.title: 开发银行旨在为气候适应提供 1,850 亿美元资金
item.description:
十个机构在缔约方大会第三十届会议上共同承诺为提高抗灾能力提供更多资金。【原文：

Ten institutions jointly pledged at COP30 to ramp up finance for resilience. 

】

item.title: 欧盟议会小组将支持 2040 年减排 90% 的目标
item.description: 欧盟议会的一个委员会将建议欧盟制定新的减排目标，这是到本世纪中期实现净零排放的关键一步。【原文：A European Union parliamentary committee is set to recommend the bloc takes on a new emissions-reduction goal, a key step on the path to net zero by midcentury.】

item.title: 德国和西班牙承诺为气候适应计划提供 1 亿美元资金
item.description: 气候投资基金（Climate Investment Funds）是世界银行内部一个价值 130 亿美元的多边机构，已从德国和西班牙筹集到 1 亿美元资金，用于一个旨在帮助穷国抵御气候变化影响的新项目。【原文：The Climate Investment Funds, a $13 billion multilateral vehicle that sits inside the World Bank, has raised $100 million in funding from Germany and Spain for a new program designed to help poor countries withstand the fallout from climate change.】

item.title: 对冲基金 Man Group 在获得 130 亿美元委托后欢呼新时代的到来
item.description: 全球最大的上市对冲基金管理公司 Man Group Plc 的客户流量正在增长，因为欧洲的一些机构投资者根据可持续发展标准重新分配了委托。【原文：Man Group Plc, the world’s largest publicly traded hedge-fund manager, is seeing growth in client flows as a number of institutional investors in Europe reassign mandates based on sustainability criteria.】

item.title: 壳牌取消苏格兰海上风电项目计划
item.description: 壳牌公司（Shell Plc）取消了在苏格兰海岸建造两个风电场的计划，因为这家英国石油巨头放弃了在这一领域的大量投资。【原文：Shell Plc canceled plans to build two wind farms off the coast of Scotland as the British oil major pulls back from significant investments in the sector.】

item.title: Nvidia 家乡的数据中心空置等待供电
item.description:
加利福尼亚州圣克拉拉市两处设施的命运凸显了美国科技行业乃至整个经济面临的重大挑战。【原文：

The fate of two facilities in Santa Clara, California, highlights a major challenge for the US tech sector and indeed the wider economy.

】

item.title: 气候谈判需要关注的四大问题
item.description: 欢迎正式参加 COP30。在上周为期两天的领导人峰会之后，缔约方大会从今天开始，至少将持续到 11 月 21 日。【原文：Welcome to COP30, officially. After the two-day leaders summit last week, the Conference of Parties starts today and will go on until at least Nov. 21.】
